medical_history.chief_complaint: RLQ abdominal pain after being struck in the abdomen by a heavy object.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began a day and a half prior to admission after the injury, initially experiencing excruciating abdominal pain which resolved in the evening. The following day, the patient reported persisting discomfort, rated as much milder than the initial pain. There are concerns about internal bleeding due to hemophilia. No fevers, chills, nausea, or vomiting occurred, and the patient has normal appetite and bowel movements.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Hemophilia A, with baseline factor VIII around 5%. Requires DDAVP 0.3 mcg/kg prior to minor procedures. History of prior hemarthroses and hematomas. 2. Diverticulosis. 3. Atypical chest pain, with negative exercise stress test. 4. Prior history of hepatitis A.
medical_history.family_history: His maternal grandfather died of bleeding complications, presumed to have had hemophilia.
